com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface consolidateToShipment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface consolidateToShipment

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document consolidateToShipment(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The consolidateToShipment API consolidates an order release to an existing shipment or creates a new shipment.

    • Method Detail

      • consolidateToShipment

        org.w3c.dom.Document consolidateToShipment(YFSEnvironment env,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                           java.rmi.RemoteException

        The consolidateToShipment API consolidates an order release to an existing shipment or creates a new shipment. This API works on order release which may or may not exist in the system.
        If Order Releases external to Sterling system is getting consolidated, then ExternalReleaseIdentifier, OrderNo and ReleaseNo uniquely identifies an external Order Release. For Orders existing in the system, passing only the OrderReleaseKey or combination of OrderHeaderKey and ReleaseNo will be enough to do the processing.
        If SCAC is passed in input, a new shipment is created.
        If Routing Guide is maintained, the department Code and Item Classification constraints are followed.
        If Special Services are passed in the input, a new shipment will be created.
        The api follows the same logic as consolidateToShipment agent, for finding and consolidating to an existing shipment.

        The Transaction ID used is : CONSOLIDATE_TO_SHIPMENT

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        If an OrderRelease matches the values of the following attributes, it is consolidated with the existing shipment.

          Attribute in OrderRelease
          ShipNode
          ReceivingNode
          ToAddressKey
          FreightTerms
          DeliveryCode
          Currency
          PackListType
          EnterpriseCode
          SellerOrganizationCode
          BuyerOrganizationCode
          DocumentType
          CarrierServiceCode
          WorkOrderKey
          WorkOrderApptKey

        In addition to above attributes, the following attributes will be used for matching if they are set up as buyer/seller constraints and routing based constraints.

          Attribute in OrderRelease
          CustomerPONo
          MarkForKey
          OrderType
          DepartmentCode
          ItemClassification of the Item on OrderLine

        User Exits:
        Following user exits are provided for this API:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforeConsolidateToShipment.
        Following user exit is called only if consolidation option exists. For example, if in the input DoNotConsolidate Flag is Passed as Y, then this user exit will not be invoked. Same will happen if the order has special services or special services is passed in the input.
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMDetermineShipmentToConsolidateWith

        Events Raised:

          ON_SUCCESS:
            Data Published - YDM_CONSOLIDATE_TO_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.html, YDM_CONSOLIDATE_TO_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key data - shipment_dbd.txt

        Template Support: Yes

        Audits:
        YFS_SHIPMENT_STATUS_AUDIT record is written if a Shipment is created. No audit is written for modification of existing Shipment.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No


Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains all the information about the Shipment. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes. in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
